author: shuwaku
title: Exhibit Largest BlockChainEXPO(JP)
description: CARDANOを主要なブロックチェーンとして認識しているのは、日本や東アジアの企業の中でもごくわずかです。そのため、現実のビジネスの世界にCARDANOを導入することは困難です。

f6_assessments.q0: この提案は、日本ではブロックチェーンとしてのカルダノの認知度が低く、"実際の "ビジネス環境での導入が進まないという問題への回答となることを目指しています。製造業、金融、小売流通、エネルギー、ヘルスケアなど、さまざまな分野の参加者が集う「ブロックチェーンEXPO」への参加を予定しています。この提案は、重要な環境下でエコシステムとしてのカルダノを普及させようとするものですが、提案の目的とチャレンジの目的の関係がわかりにくいと思います。提案書には、コミュニティの形成については一切書かれていません。唯一コミュニティ形成に言及している部分は、「300回のフォローアップを伴う具体的なコラボレーション」という記述だろうが、それ以外は文脈上何も明記されていない。
f6_assessments.q1: メンバーのスキルや経験について、よく書かれた説明を用意してくれたチームに感謝します。このことは、ideascaleでの記述が拡張されているだけでなく、YouTubeチャンネル、Twitter、カリキュラムのサマリーシートなどへの追加リンクが提示されている、発表されたWebページで確認することができます。  予算の大部分がブースの建設に充てられているため、その値が妥当であるかどうかは、現地の状況に大きく左右されるため判断が難しい。タイムラインでは、今後のアクションの詳細が示されており、合理的だと思います。
f6_assessments.q2: 監査可能性に関しては、チームは素晴らしい結果を出しました。重要なマイルストーンについての明確な説明があり、5つのマイルストーンを簡単な説明とともに示し、コミュニティが何がいつ起こるのかを両方とも認識できるようにしています。また、すでにイベントへの登録が完了していることも示されています。さらに、万博ステークプールが管理するウェブページを参照することで、提案書の監査性を高めています。成功指標が非常に大胆であることは、チームのモチベーションと自信の高さを示しています。以上のことから、私は、このコミュニティが監査に必要な要素を備えていると確信しています。

f6_assessments.q0: Very effective. There are many ADA holders in Japan, and in order to get them involved in the community, it is necessary to increase the adoption cases of Cardano in Japan. Exhibiting at domestic EXPO events is the most effective way to reach other companies. Furthermore, at EXPO events, many companies from industries other than blockchain will also participate, so we can expect greater scalability than expected. In conclusion, I give a rating of 5.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility is very high. First, their team made similar proposals in Fund 6 and achieved all KPIs. Second, they have a team of more than 10 people who are closely associated with the Cardano community. Finally, most of the budget is allocated to booth exhibition costs, and other costs are set appropriately. And each has the necessary information links. In conclusion, I give a rating of 5.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability is very high. The roadmap and KPI settings provided are also very clear. However, it is important to report on progress with the companies that followed up through the event. I think it is necessary to fully prepare these reporting systems. In conclusion, I give a rating of 4.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer does a good job in explaining the problem in Japan i.e. the low profile of Cardano within the business word, but not much facts are presented for East Asia as a whole. If there is a Blockchain Expo in Japan (I checked and it is occurring Tokyo May 2022), then Cardano should certainly feature, and this represents a good solution to the problem. This would have fitted better within the Connecting Japan community, as there is no mention here of improving or creating hubs but there are synergies with the Scale-up Cardano’s CH, as new users and organizations could be onboarded via this event. As it stands this proposal would culminate in a one-off event that will always be of limited reach, the proposal could scale this by sharing it’s learning with other community hubs (to set-up their own boots in different expos) or even expand it’s presence to other expo’s outside Japan
f6_assessments.q1: A sizeable team is described, with some verifiable links presented on the website. Most team members seem to manage their own SPO. The team leader also a few YouTube videos, that even though don’t have much engagement (low views and comments), shows his dedication and interest in Cardano (I don’t speak Japanese so can’t comment on the content). The proposer states that they participated in the previous the 2021 Expo and attracted 3000 visitors, this is a great demonstration of experience so would have been beneficial if the proposer could have shown proof of this for voter re-assurance. The plan of engagement within the expo is well laid out, with different teams tasked with achieving minimum goals. Besides mention of Plutus Pioneer Program, and Atala, it would be good to know what other topics would be introduced e.g. staking, upcoming DeFi projects, Project Catalyst, etc. The Timelines presented look reasonable. The requested budget also looks reasonable and is itemized, although would be beneficial to explain what the $55k for booth exactly means, are these the fees you need to pay the expo organizers? and given you have already secured a booth has any payment already been performed?
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with relevant milestones and timings is presented. A number of hard KPI’s are provided such as number of brochures distributed, but also some related to the impact of your booth such as number of stakepools created, and inquiries into the Plutus Pioneer program. I assume the actual indicators would be published on your website ? would be good to confirm this as for example I couldn’t find any metrics from your previous expo presence. Some KPI’s regarding your preparation for the expo could also have been provided e.g. could you provide the community with the flyers/brochures you intent to distribute when these are finished ? I understand that these will likely only be in Japanese, but we can always Google translate

solution: JP最大のビジネスイベントであるB.C.EXPOに出展し、日本のフォーチュン500企業や公的機関にカルダノを紹介します。
experience: Cardano Youtuber / SPO / DC Sparkメンバー / オフィシャルアンバサダー / 弁護士 / 公認会計士 / Atara Prism Pioneers Programメンバー
